questions.description: On reflection from a plane surface, the following may get changed -
The images of clouds and trees in water always less bright than in reality -

options.description: because water is forming the image dirty.
because there is an optical illusion due to which the image appears to be less bright.
because only a portion of the incident light is reflected and quite a large portion goes into the water.
because air above the surface of water contains a lot of moisture.

questions.description: The image of a real object formed by a plane mirror is-

options.description: Erect, real and of equal size
Erect, virtual and of equal size
Inverted, real and of equal size
Inverted, virtual and of equal size

questions.description: Focal length of a plane mirror is -
An object is at a distance of 0.5 m in front of a plane mirror. Distance between the object and image is -
In case of image formation by plane mirrors -

options.description: Object can be real and image virtual
Object can be virtual and image real
Both object and image can be real

questions.description: A point source of light is placed in front of a plane mirror -

options.description: All the reflected rays meet at a point when produced backward.
Only the reflected rays close to the normal meet at a point when produced backward.
Only the reflected rays making a small angle with the mirror, meet at a point when produced backward.
Light of different colours make different images.

questions.description:
Assertion : Plane and convex mirrors can produce real images of objects.
Reason : A plane or convex mirror can produce a real image if the object is virtual.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description:
Assertion : A virtual image cannot be produced on a screen.
Reason : The light energy does not meet at the point(s) where virtual image is formed.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description: The rear-view mirror of a car is -
A mirror forms a real image of unit magnification for real object. Its nature is -
While using an electric bulb, the reflection for street lighting should be from -
A person sees his virtual image by holding a mirror very close to the face. When he moves the mirror away from his face, the image becomes inverted. What type of mirror he is using -
The distance of an object from a spherical mirror is equal to the focal length of the mirror. Then the image-
Which of the following could not produce a virtual image

options.description: All the above can produce a virtual image

questions.description: If lower half part of the spherical mirror is covered by black paper, then which of the following changes -
Which of the following mirrors forms a virtual smaller image of real object -
The focal length of a convex mirror is 20 cm its radius of curvature will be -
Just before the time of sun set or shine the sun appears to be oval because -

options.description: The sun changes its shape at that time

questions.description: We see the sun a little before it rises on the horizon and a little after it sets below the horizon. This is a consequence of the phenomenon of -

Assertion : When a diver under water looks obliquely at a fisherman standing on the bank of a lake then fisherman looks taller.
Reason : When a ray of light travelling in air enters water, it bends towards the normal.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description: If the angle of a prism is 60° and angle of minimum deviation is 40°, then the angle of refraction will be -
Dispersive power of a prism depends on-
In above question, the angle of minimum deviation is nearly -
In minimum deviation conditions a light ray passing through an equilateral prism travels -

options.description: parallel to the base (non-refracting side) of the prism
perpendicular to the first refracting surface
perpendicular to the second refracting surface.

questions.description: When light is passed through a prism, the colour which deviates least is -
Two thin prisms of crown glass have refracting angles of 10 degrees and 20 degrees. The dispersive powers of these prisms are :
Indicate the correct statement in the following -

options.description: The dispersive power depends upon the angle of prism.
The angular dispersion depends on angle of prism.
The angular dispersion does not depend upon the dispersive power.
The dispersive power in vacuum is one.

questions.description: The refracting angle of prism A is small. The correct statement for the dispersive power of a prism is that dispersive power -

options.description: Depends upon the material of the prism
Depends upon both material & refracting angle of prism
Depends only upon refracting angle of prism
Is same for all colors of white light

questions.description: The image for the converging beam after refraction through the curved surface is formed at -
A Plano convex lens is made of glass of refractive index 1.5. The radius of curvature of its convex surface is R. Its focal length is -
A convex lens is dipped in a liquid whose refractive index is equal to the refractive index of the lens. Then its focal length will -
An object is immersed in a fluid. In order that the object becomes invisible, it should -

options.description: Absorb all light falling on it
Have refractive index exactly matching with that of the surrounding fluid.

questions.description: A point object is placed at the focus of a double concave lens. The image is formed -

options.description: between the focus and the lens

questions.description: What will happen if half of a lens is covered by a black cloth -

options.description: The size of the image will be reduced to half
The shining of the image will diminish

questions.description: A convex lens is made up of three different materials as shown in the figure. For a point object placed on its axis, the number of image formed are :
The given lens is broken into four parts rearranged as shown. If the initial focal length is f, then after rearrangement the equivalent focal length is -
Two lenses of focal length f₁ = 10 cm and f₂ = – 20 cm are kept as shown. The resultant power of combination will be -

Four identical lenses are kept one beside the other on the same optical axis as shown figure. The right surface of rightmost lens is silvered. Focal length of each lens is 10 cm and radius of the silvered surface is 10 cm. The focal length of the combined system is -
Figure shows three lenses of equal radii of curvature of the curved surface. The ratio of focal lengths of P, Q and R is -
